original: JOHANSSON, Johan Albert, Gruvingenjör, Nora, f Grangärde, Kopparb l, 31/1 81 av gruväg o hdsdom P J Jansson o Christina Andersson, gm Maja Hedblad. Bergssk Falun 00—01, e. elev KTH (bergsvetensk) 02—03. Bitr h konsult gruving 01—02, gruving o kem v Nautanens o Liikavaara kopparmalmsfält 04—06, behör gruvmät 06, gruving o förvalt v A/S Skandia Kobberverk Norge 07—08, v Skaar gruber 08—13, bitr v Sv Geol Undersökes undersökn av mell Sv:s kända järn-malmstillg 08, gruving o gruvmät h Nora Bergsl Gemens Förvaltn Striberg 14—38, nu konsult verksamh i Nora. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Komunalflm Nora Idskommun 23—38, ordf där 26—38, kyrkoflm Nora stads- o bergsförs 32— 38, led av styr f Åkerby skyddshem 32—36 samt fi kommunala nmdr. Ldstm i öbr l 31— 34 o 39—46. °JOHANSSON, Albin, Ingenjör, Göteborg, f Spekeröds s :n, Bohusl, 21/3 68. El stud, prakt h bl a Schuckert & Co Nurnberg. Anst öl el.-mek föret, verkm Boye & Thoresens El AB. Eg fma, Albin Johanssons El aff, Gbg, sed. 06, Gbgs elvks entrep. SM Gbg 94 f el instrum 0 apparater.
translated: JOHANSSON, Johan Albert, Mining Engineer, Nora, born in Grangärde, Kopparberg County, January 31, 1881, son of mine captain P J Jansson and Christina Andersson, married to Maja Hedblad. Bergsskola (Mining School) Falun 1900-1901, student at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) (mining science) 1902-1903. Assistant at a mining consulting firm 1901-1902, mining and chemistry at Nautanens and Liikavaara copper ore fields 1904-1906, certified mine surveyor 1906, mining and management at A/S Skandia Kobberverk in Norway 1907-1908, at Skaar mines 1908-1913, assistant at the Geological Survey of Sweden for the investigation of known iron ore deposits in central Sweden 1908, mining and mine surveying at Nora Bergsl Gemens Förvaltn Striberg 1914-1938, currently working as a consultant in Nora. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Member of the Nora School Board 1923-1938, chairman from 1926-1938, member of the Nora city and mining parish church board 1932-1938, member of the board of Åkerby shelter home 1932-1936, and various other municipal committees. Oldest man in the region in 1931-1934 and 1939-1946. JOHANSSON, Albin, Engineer, Gothenburg, born in Spekeröd, Bohuslän, March 21, 1868. Electrical engineering studies and practical experience, including at Schuckert & Co in Nuremberg. Employed by various electrical and mechanical companies, started own business, Albin Johanssons El aff (electrical store), in Gothenburg since 1906, contractor for electrical installations in Gothenburg 1894, specializing in electrical instruments and apparatus. Note: The specification '\d\d m. partners name' indicates that the person got married in the year 19xx.

structured.name: Johan Albert Johansson
structured.description: Johan Albert Johansson was a Swedish mining engineer born on January 31, 1881, in Grangärde. He was married to Maja Hedblad. Johansson attended Bergsskola in Falun from 1900 to 1901 and studied Mining Science at the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1902 to 1903. He worked as a mining engineer for various organizations, including Sv Geol Undersökes, A/S Skandia Kobberverk (in Norway), Skaar gruber, and Nora Bergsl Gemens Förvaltn Striberg. Johansson was a member of Sv Tekn.frn. He was also actively involved in various local organizations such as Nora Idskommun and Åkerby skyddshem. Johansson's career spanned from 1901 to 1938.

career.occupational_title: Assistant at a mining consulting firm

career.workplace: Nautanens and Liikavaara copper ore fields

career.occupational_title: Student at Royal Institute of Technology
